prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom The first part is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.25, 0.0] Step 2: Generate the 2D sketch Generate a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Step 3: Create the loops and faces Create a single face in the sketch with the following loop: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.125] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.125], End Point [0.25, 0.125] - Line 4: Start Point [0.25, 0.125], End Point [0.25, 0.5] - Line 5: Start Point [0.25, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] - Line 6: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The loop is a closed path consisting of six line segments. Step 4: Scale the sketch Scale the 2D sketch horizontally by a factor of 0.75. Step 5: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles and translation vector specified in the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.125 units towards the normal, and by an additional 0.125 units opposite the normal. The final dimensions of this part are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.25 units - Height: 0.75 units Overall, the part is a rectangular prism with a single vertical edge slightly angled from the top to the bottom.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.25,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.125]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.125],"End Point":[0.25,0.125]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.125],"End Point":[0.25,0.5]},"line_5":{"Start Point":[0.25,0.5],"End Point":[0.0,0.5]},"line_6":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.5],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.125,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.125,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**CAD Model Instructions** **Part 1: Base Rectangular Prism** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin of the white background. Then, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Create a face with a loop consisting of four straight lines. 1. Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.75, 0) 2. Line 2: Start Point (0.75, 0), End Point (0.75, 0.75) 3. Line 3: Start Point (0.75, 0.75), End Point (0, 0.75) 4. Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.75), End Point (0, 0) Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Next, transform this scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the rotation and translation data provided in the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis to create the 3D model. Set the extrusion depth to 0.01 units. This will be your first CAD part. **Part 2: Rectangular Prism with Cylindrical Hole** Construct a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism is positioned diagonally from the top left to the bottom right corner of the image. The cylindrical hole is centered on the prism and is slightly smaller in height than the prism. The prism has a flat top and bottom surface. The cylindrical hole has a flat bottom surface and a curved top surface. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the point (0.725, 0, 0.01) relative to the previous part. Then, draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Create a face with two loops: one for the square outline and one for the circular hole. For the square outline loop: 1. Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.025, 0) 2. Line 2: Start Point (0.025, 0), End Point (0.025, 0.025) 3. Line 3: Start Point (0.025, 0.025), End Point (0, 0.025) 4. Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.025), End Point (0, 0) For the circular hole loop: - Draw a circle centered at (0.0125, 0.0125) with a radius of 0.0125. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Next, transform this scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the rotation and translation data provided in the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis to create the 3D model. Set the extrusion depth to 0.25 units, extending from 0.01 to 0.26 units along the Z-axis. This will be your second CAD part, joined with the previous part.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.0],"End Point":[0.75,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.75,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.01,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.725,0.0,0.01]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.025,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.025,0.0],"End Point":[0.025,0.025]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.025,0.025],"End Point":[0.0,0.025]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.025],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.725],"End Point":[0.025,0.725]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.025,0.725],"End Point":[0.025,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.025,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.725]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.25,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"JoinFeatureOperation"}}}}

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Create the base prism Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.5, 0.0] Now define the 2D sketch for the base prism on the XY plane with the following lines: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop and scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the current coordinate system. Extrude the sketch into a 3D model with the parameters as follows: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.5 units * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0 units * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body Part 2 Instructions Create the tapered top Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.5] Now draw the 2D sketch for the tapered top on the XY plane with the following lines (in the order given): * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.5, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.125] * Line 4: Start Point [0.75, 0.125], End Point [0.375, 0.5] * Line 5: Start Point [0.375, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] Close the loop and scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch to a 3D sketch with the current coordinate system and extrude the sketch into a 3D model with the following details: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0 units * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.25 units * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: Remove the material from the base prism</description>

prompt: <description>**CAD Model Generation Instructions** **Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw the first face: a. Draw the first line from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0]. b. Draw the second line from [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.25]. c. Draw the arc from [0.5, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.25] with the mid point at [0.25, 0.5]. d. Close the loop with the fourth line from [0.0, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.0]. 3. Scale the sketch by 0.5. 4. Extrude the sketch by 0.75 units along the positive normal direction. **Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and a translation vector of [0.75, 0.0, 0.125]. 2. Draw the first face: a. Draw the first line from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0]. b. Draw the second line from [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.125]. c. Draw the arc from [0.5, 0.125] to [0.0, 0.125] with the mid point at [0.25, 0.375]. d. Close the loop with the fourth line from [0.0, 0.125] to [0.0, 0.0]. 3. Draw the second face: a. Draw the first arc from [0.0, 0.125] to [0.5, 0.125] with the mid point at [0.25, 0.375]. b. Draw the second line from [0.5, 0.125] to [0.5, 0.5]. c. Draw the third line from [0.5, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.5]. d. Draw the fourth line from [0.0, 0.5] to [0.0, 0.125]. 4. Scale the sketch by 0.5. 5. Cut the sketch by 0.5 units along the negative normal direction. **Part 3: Cylindrical hole** 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.375, 0.25, 0.375]. 2. Draw a circle with the center at [0.375, 0.25] and a radius of 0.125. 3. Scale the sketch by 1.0. 4. Extrude the sketch by 0.5 units along the positive normal direction. **Final Shape** 1. Combine the three parts using a join operation to create the final shape. Note: The final shape is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat base and a flat top. The cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The prism is symmetrical along its central axis. The dimensions of the rectangular prism are 0.75 x 0.5 x 0.5 and the cylindrical hole has a radius of 0.125 and a height of 0.5.</description>
